title: If you report someone for verbal abuse, don't let the matchmaking system put you in game with them..
body:
Getting mighty sick and tired of being abused by some keyboard crusader for 40 minutes when I have a bad game, only to queue up again and get the same keyboard crusader in the next game, abusing me in champ select until I can get in game to mute them.

Sure you can mute, but the game is already a negative cesspool from minute one, and muting them doesn't stop them typing the abuse and being distracted.

 Is it so hard that when you block/report someone for verbal abuse that you aren't able to be matched together again? Even if for only 24 hours?

replies.body: Honestly I thought that's how it worked as well, though apparently it just hasn't been implemented. Thought it was one of those things that goes without saying, you know?

u would think so, but nope!.
its laziness, and until the community starts working together we wont see a change IMO, but then again people wont even work together in groups of 5 so the chances of getting something like this changed to better the game for all players is like 0.000 000 000 01 %

Doing that could easily be abused, say you have someone who you thought was doing really %%%%y in your team, report and you wont play with them again. same goes for enemy team, report someone on the enemy team for it, and you wont get matched again.

Good idea, but very easily abused.
